data.title: Bubble Shooter XP
data.meta_description: A classic free to play HTML5 version of Bubble Shooter that replicates the game from Windows 95 and XP. Test your aim and prove your blasting skills. No need to download or install anything.
data.text:
Play the classic and most addictive bubble pop game for free, match 3 colors and clear levels. Get ready to pop into a world of colorful fun with Bubble Shooter! This classic arcade game invites players to aim, shoot, and burst their way through a vibrant universe of bubbles. With simple yet addictive gameplay, Bubble Shooter challenges you to clear the screen by forming groups of three or more bubbles of the same color. Strategize your shots, watch the bubbles explode, and score big points!

About Bubble Shooter

The history of Bubble Shooter is a fascinating journey through the evolution of gaming. The game traces its roots back to a Japanese company named Taito Corporation, which specialized in arcade games. In 1994, Taito released a game called Puzzle Bobble, also known as Bust-a-Move in some Western countries. This game laid the foundation for what would become the Bubble Shooter we know today.

The original Bubble Shooter game, as we recognize it, was developed and released by Absolutist LTD in 2002. It was a clone of Puzzle Bobble and quickly gained popularity due to its engaging and straightforward gameplay. The game was later ported to iOS in 2010 and to Android in 2012, making it accessible to a broader audience.

In 2015, a significant development occurred when Ilyon Dynamics LTD, an Israeli-based startup, acquired the Bubble Shooter IP from Absolutist. Ilyon Dynamics expanded the game’s reach by improving the design and gameplay, adapting it for mobile platforms like Facebook Messenger and the mobile eSports platform Skillz. This move significantly boosted the game’s popularity and led to a surge in demand for similar games.

The success of Bubble Shooter has made it a general title for all clones, and it continues to be a beloved game for players around the world. Its history is a testament to the enduring appeal of simple yet captivating game mechanics.

More Games

Solitaire Windows XP - The object of this Solitaire is to use all the cards in the deck to build up the four suit stacks in ascending order, beginning with the aces. To achieve this, you can temporary use the seven row stacks in descending order, alternating between red and black cards, beginning with the kings.

FreeCell XP - Do you remember how you discovered Solitaire games? Most probably you did when you got your first computer. You might even remember how the menu looked like back in the day. FreeCell XP will make you feel like you are back in time. This game looks exactly like the one that was installed on your old computer.

Spider Solitaire Windows XP - The online game Spider Solitaire Windows XP is a similar version of a legendary and quite popular Solitaire game that comes free with Microsoft Windows XP operating systems. Many people spent hours playing this game on their old computers. And now it’s available online.
